isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - AIR PRESSURE GAUGES - SERVICE CHECKS

step1.para: Inspect connections to assure no air leakage at gauge or in the system.

It is not compulsory but it is advisable that vehicles be inspected to be sure that the air gauges are properly installed. The primary system should be the gauge with number 1 on the gauge face. The secondary system is the gauge with number 2 on the gauge face.
To check for correct gauge installation, charge the air system (full), bleeding off the primary system (rear brake reservoir). Gauge number 1 should drop.

Check the air gauge for accuracy. The simplest way to do this is to compare the pressures registered by the gauge over its normal pressure range with the pressure registered by a test gauge known to be accurate.

caution.para: Only test gauges known to be accurate are to be used for checking brake valve delivery pressures, governor pressure settings and other tests.

step1.para: A gauge which loses its accuracy must be replaced. The continued use of a dash gauge showing an error of more than 5 psi is not recommended.
